name: less_opportunity_than_parents
description: The share of surveyed young people in each country that responded "yes" to the statement that: "They will have less opportunities in life than their parents due to climate change".
datasetName: Young people opinions climate change (Hickman et al. 2021)

source.name: Hickman et al. (2021). Climate anxiety in children and young people and their beliefs about government responses to climate change: a global survey.
source.dataPublishedBy: Hickman, C., Marks, E., Pihkala, P., Clayton, S., Lewandowski, R. E., Mayall, E. E., ... & van Susteren, L. (2021). Climate anxiety in children and young people and their beliefs about government responses to climate change: a global survey. The Lancet Planetary Health, 5(12), e863-e873.
source.additionalInfo:
Hickman et al. (2021) surveyed young people, aged 16-to-25 years old, about their attitudes to climate change.

The total sample of this survey was approximately 10,000 people. This was split across 10 countries, which approximately 1,000 people in each country in the sample.
